abstract.text: The visual representation of a path-based overlay.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: object defines your overlay’s shape. By default, this renderer fills the overlay’s shape and represents the strokes of the path using its current attributes.
You can use this class as-is or subclass it to define additional drawing behaviors. If you subclass it, override the
method and use that method to build the appropriate path object. To change the path, invalidate it and recreate the path using the new data your subclass obtains.

abstract.text: An immutable graphics path: a mathematical description of shapes or lines to be drawn in a graphics context.
Display map or satellite imagery within your app, call out points of interest, and determine placemark information for map coordinates.
The visual representation of a circular overlay.
A collection of multiple closed polygon overlays.
The visual representation of multiple polygon overlays.
A visual representation of multiple polyline overlay objects.
The visual representation of a path-based overlay.
Applies the receiver’s fill-related drawing properties to the specified graphics context.
Applies the renderer’s stroke-related drawing properties to the specified graphics context.
Creates the path for the overlay.
The fill color to use for the path.
Fills the area that the specified path encloses.
Updates the path associated with the overlay renderer.
The line cap style to apply to the open ends of the path.
An array of numbers specifying the dash pattern to use for the path.
The offset (in points) at which to start drawing the dash pattern.
The line join style to apply to the corners of the path.
The stroke width to use for the path.
The limiting value that helps avoid spikes at junctions between connected line segments.
The path representing the overlay’s shape.
A Boolean value that determines whether the overlay path renderer renders the overlay as a bitmap before compositing.
The stroke color to use for the path.
Draws a line along the specified path.
The shared infrastructure for drawing overlays on the map surface.
A closed polygon overlay.
The visual representation of a single polygon overlay.
A visual representation of any polyline overlay object.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
